description.narrative: UNICEF utilizes guidance, tools and resources to effectively influence the design, implementation, monitoring, evaluation and dissemination of development policies and programmes that promote, guarantee and impact children's rights., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system

"UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)"

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF utilizes guidance, tools and resources to effectively influence the design, implementation, monitoring, evaluation and dissemination of development policies and programmes that promote, guarantee and impact children’s rights.

description.narrative: In 2019, SPM&E continued to work in collaboration with other Programme teams to develop: (i) two data-driven publications on the situation of children (CRC@30) and on UNICEF's flagship initiative with municipalities (UNICEF Seal); (ii) tools for improved evidence-based advocacy products, such as the Data Panorama; (iii) system enhancements for the Seal monitoring platform; (iv) technical assistance on key studies and evaluations; and (v) improved partnerships with research institutions and the government (IBGE, IPEA, SECAP) to enhanced evidence generation and strengthen the evaluation function. ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: % of annual IMEP activities completed or on track
Existence and utilization of disaggregated data on the most excluded children in Brazil at federal, state and municipal levels.

baseline.value: Lack and limited use of disaggregated data on excluded children in Brazil
